results.title: Engineering Team Lead
results.description:
About Covidence

Our mission is to dramatically improve lives by changing the way the world creates and uses knowledge.

Launched in 2014 Covidence is a world leading SAAS platform that enables health and science research teams to rapidly synthesize and uncover actionable insights from the mountains research produced around the world. We do this by accelerating a research workflow called ‚Äòsystematic review,' the gold standard for synthesizing research evidence. Many of the world's most prestigious and innovative universities and hospitals are Covidence subscribers.

We are embarking on a new phase of growth which will see our product offering expanding and our engineering team significantly growing.

The perks and benefits

  • Great salary: we pay competitively and review salaries regularly
  • 100% remote: live and work where you choose whilst ensuring a 6 hour crossover with the AEST 9AM-5PM work day
  • 5 weeks paid leave: 4 weeks standard plus a bonus week at Christmas, a day off for your birthday and the option to purchase 3 more weeks pro rata
  • Flexible start date: want to take a holiday first? Let us know what your preferred start date is.
  • Knowledge allowance: so you keep learning and developing,
  • Impact: by working here you will have more impact on humanity than an individual scientist
  • Monthly home allowance to set up and run your home office

The opportunity

Covidence is seeking an Engineering Team Lead to join our Product & Engineering team, reporting to our Head of Engineering.¬†

This is a newly created role and level. In the past 12 months we've grown the engineering team from 3 to 9 members and we will continue to scale the team over the coming years.

We're keen to chat to candidates from all levels of management experience to learn about the talents you can bring to our team. Our ideal candidate is someone who loves to make a difference; a self-starter who pitches in and embodies our values: One team, Find a way and Honour Knowledge.

You'll get to

  • Manage a team of 4+ mid/senior engineers and drive their career growth paths
  • Partner with product managers, designers and customer support so that the right feedback loops are in place to discover and deliver valuable, usable, and buildable outcomes
  • Hire and onboard new team members as we grow
  • Support your team to deliver high-quality software¬†
  • Ensure we make architecturally-sound engineering decisions
  • Drive engineering best practices like code review and pair programming
  • Refine the team's processes to improve development, quality assurance, and delivery
  • Use modern tools of the trade - Macbook Pro, Slack, Zoom, GSuite, Miro, Confluence and Figma

What you bring:

  • Experience and great passion in leading or mentoring software engineers
  • Advocate of DevOps/SRE culture
  • Great communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Experience in architecting scalable Ruby on Rails applications
  • A keen interest in modern technologies such as React and PostgreSQL
  • A reasoned and pragmatic approach to software development and testing
  • A love of problem-solving
  • Experience working in an agile development environment
  • Interest in data and ML for future growth

Our platform

We build new features to support our vision and at the same time modernise our technology for scale. Here's a summary of our tech stack:

  • Backend: Ruby on Rails, Ruby, postgreSQL
  • Frontend: React, Typescript, GraphQL, HTML, CSS, Javascript frameworks
  • DevOps: AWS, Heroku
  • Monitoring tools: Sentry, Datadog
  • CI/CD experience: Buildkite

We don't need you to be experienced in all of these technologies but some exposure would be desirable.

The interview process

If you are interested in this opportunity, please hit APPLY and send us through your details. We'll be back in touch with you promptly.¬†

Should we proceed further you can expect 4 rounds of interviews:

  • Round 1: 30 min Zoom interview for us to get to know each other
  • Round 2: 60 min Zoom interview diving into your technical and leadership experiences
  • Round 3: 90 min Zoom interview where you'll complete a practical exercise with some of our team members
  • Round 4: 60 min interview with our CTO

In a hurry? We can speed this process up if needed - just let us know!

When you join Covidence you are joining a team that cares deeply for what we can build and achieve together. If you are ready to be more than just a cog in the machine; if you are smart, curious, want to create change, and are not scared of getting your hands dirty to make it happen ‚Äì then this is the place for you.

results.title: Back End Software Developer
results.description:
Optimile is an international software as a service (SaaS) company, providing a range of applications in the field of mobility. Optimile has developed a cloud based platform that takes a Charging as a Service (CaaS) and Mobility as a Service (MaaS) approach in order to connect users with various means of transport.
Optimile offers a white label charge point operator (CPO) and mobility service provider (MSP) platform for electric vehicles and charging infrastructure to professional customers worldwide. Optimile is based in Ghent, Belgium. We operate in seven countries across 213.000 charging points, of which 11.000 with our own label. The shareholders of Optimile are BNP Paribas Fortis, Touring and AG Insurance.

Our platform creates a connection between different mobility services and users, and is responsible for managing various charging points for electric vehicles. Through the linked app, transport information and budgeting is easily accessible to the users. To support our fast growth, we are looking for a remote Back End Software Developer to strengthen our development team.

Your role

  • You will work on our new, ecologically responsible form of networked mobility, building and improving the backbone of our platform.
  • You'll link and integrate services in the back office system (Python and Django) and be responsible for documenting and writing automated tests.
  • You'll be contributing to the further development of our change point management system for electrical vehicles and the integration of various mobility platforms.
  • You'll set up roaming connections with other charging station operators.

Over the last ten years, SaaS has changed the way we work ‚Äî for the better. Slack instead of email. Miro instead of sticky notes. Airtable instead of Excel. SaaS is helping tech companies move so much faster, but it‚Äôs also introducing a new surface area of risk they‚Äôve never seen before. The risk of leaking sensitive data. As a result, companies are faced with answering the difficult question of how to manage compounding security risks as they grow without introducing more red tape that slows their team members down.

At Metomic, we help tech companies save time & reduce costs by minimising their sensitive data footprint in cloud applications like Slack, Google Drive and Zendesk.

Our technology includes native integrations with dozens of cloud apps, AI to detect thousands of sensitive data types, and advanced functionality to manipulate data at scale (redaction, retention, access controls, etc). All from one place. This liberates tech companies to make full use of their favourite SaaS apps as they grow, whilst Metomic takes care of all the security risks behind the scenes.

After launching our product in April 2021, we now count some of the world‚Äôs most innovative companies as customers, such as Zego, Clearcover, Omnipresent, Travelperk and Jumio. Our revenue is growing quickly and we‚Äôre backed by some great investors like Connect (investors in CityMapper, Typeform, Marvel), LocalGlobe (Improbable, Figma, Zego) and RFC (Hopin, Clubhouse, On Deck, etc).

¬†

Engineering Team

As we continue to change the way companies deal with their sensitive data, our Engineering Team (currently 8 strong) is growing and we‚Äôre looking to welcome Software Engineers, either back-end or full-stack, to our team to be part of this journey.

Some of the areas you may be working on: Our sensitive data and classification engine, building systems to allow us to process billions of messages a day, data ingest pipelines, sensitive data remediation system, risk identification and ranking engines and alerting systems.

Our back-end services are written in Typescript and make extensive use of Kafka, GraphQL and Postgres. Our front-end is written in React/TypeScript. Our house style is grounded in functional programming principles. We use AWS ECS Fargate via github actions and Terraform to deploy to production multiple times a day.

But we know Metomic has a home within the security stack of every company in the world that has sensitive data in cloud applications. This means our eyes will turn to how we scale our codebase, architecture, security and engineering processes to provide the best experience possible to larger and more complex enterprise customers.
